Posts.Content: On 2/20/2008 karen30 wrote: Thanks! I am now told I need a mammogram. I had a baby about 18 months ago and the milk isn't drying up so they are worried. Should I be worried? Karen,     Milk not drying up by itself is not a concern. I know mothers who nursed their children right upto age 3. If you are nursing your child the milk won't dry up - doesn't have to. WHO recommends nursing for 24 months, while AMA recommends 12 months. Take care, and I will pray that the mammogram comes out clear. Priya.
Posts.Title: Need help please!
